  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING OUT POWDER. THE ADMIN PLACED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED TOTE AND BROUGHT IT TO THE HAZ CAGE FOR INSPECTION. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE CONTAINED A 50LB BAG OF COPPER SULFATE THAT HAD BEEN TORN CAUSING IT TO SPILL OUT SOME OF THE POWDER. THE PACKAGE WAS ALSO NOT LABELED WITH ANY MARKINGS OTHER THAN THE SHIPPING LABEL. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: EVERYTHING WAS PLACED INSIDE A LINED DRUM FOR PROCESSING.

DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package and contents were placed in a lined hazmat tote to mitigate spillage. 2. X-2023070849 SequenceEvent: The package was taken out of system flow due to noted spillage, upon inspection of inner contents the spray nozzle on one of the bottles was loose causing spillage, due to the spillage the rest of the bottles inside the package were soiled. DescribePack: Loose spray nozzle. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package and contents were placed in a lined hazmat tote to mitigate spillage. 3.   • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged bottle leaked from being crushed by the gallon canister, causing the cap to pop off. Only had the inner packing on top and did not block and brace the contents. Absorbent sheets were used for the cleanup and placed in the lined tote with the package. DescribePack: From inspecting the package, there was no visible damage, like a point of impact to indicate any miss handling. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediately was bagged and put in the lined tote,

item.title: Report X-2023070829
item.description:
Report X-2023070829

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered leaking when the employee attempted to move it off the conveyer belt and some of the contents spilled on the person's limb. The shipment was then removed from the sort stream and placed into a plastic lined container. The excess liquid was soaked up with neutral absorbent materials. The employee notified a manager and was taken care of per the SCMS report filed by the manager . DescribePack: The cap had become separated from one of the bottles allowing leakage to occur. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up by neutral absorbent materials while the rest of the shipment was removed from the discovery site and put into a plastic lined container.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: AFTER UNLOADING THE PACKAGE OFF OF THE TRAILER THE PACKAGE HANDLER PUSHED THE PACKAGE ONTO THE ROLLERS BUT UNFORTUNATELY THE ROLLERS DIDI NOT HAVE A GUARD ON THE END OF THE ROLLERS, THIS CAUSED THE PACKAGE TO SLIP OFF AND FALL TO THE FLOOR CAUSING ONE OF THE GLASS JUGS TO BREAK DescribePack: THE WHOLE GLASS JUG WAS SHATTERED INTO PEICES DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: UNLOAD IMMEDIATELY REPLACED THE GUARD ON THE ROLLERS TO ENSURE NO OTHER PACKAGES WERE DAMAGED

item.title: Report X-2023070811
item.description:
Report X-2023070811

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: OMAHA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While processing hazmat packages noticed one was leaking, put on gloves and determined which package was leaking. Once identified, placed package in a container and transported to hazmat cage. Opened fiberboard box and there were 4 gallons of liquid inside the box. Noticed that one of the gallons had less liquid in it. Cleaned up minor spilling on cart carrying hazmats using approved paper towels. DescribePack: Unknown where the package failed just noticed box was wet on bottom and upon opening the box noticed that one of the gallons had less liquid than the other 3 gallons had. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediately placed hazmat in salvage drum to avoid spilling on surfaces and other packages. Where hazmat initially was noticed leaking wiped spillage up with paper towels approved for cleaning up spills.

item.title: Report X-2023070792
item.description:
Report X-2023070792

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: SANTA MARIA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At the beginning of the sort this package came out of a trailer during unload and was placed on a spill tray until QA could retrieve it. When QA retrieved it they put on nitrile gloves, and placed the damaged item in 2 plastic non-haz bags and then into a lined bin. QA took the time to look around the area for any residue to clean it up off the surface(s). Using a cart the damaged package was wheeled over to the QA station in unload. DescribePack: Due to leaks from the items inside the outer box got wet and due to the corrosive nature of the cleaner a hole was created on the side of the package about the size of 2 fists. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The manager in the unload put the damaged box onto a spill tray and QA used non-haz bags and also put it into a lined bin for good measure. QA also went a bit further and inspected the surrounding area where the package came out of from the trailer as well as around the spill tray to soak/clean up any remaining residue.

item.title: Report X-2023070790
item.description:
Report X-2023070790

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was unloaded from the trailer and placed on the ground. Was informed by the manager who opened the trailer door that it smelled very strong as soon as he lifted the door. He noticed the hazmat package right then and notified QA personnel immediately. The hazmat package was slightly leaking so it was placed in a hazardous materials tote and taken to the hazmat processing area for further inspection. Spill was very miniscule as the fiberboard absorbed majority of the liquid. DescribePack: The outside of the package is labeled "CONTAINS 12 - 1 LITERS" but inside the package were only 4 - 1 Liter plastic bottles with no other packaging material to prevent movement. The amount of empty space and room for bottles to move about during transit caused a lid on one of the 1-Liter bottles to open, resulting in 1/2 liter spill from the inside of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The manager who lifted the trailer door and unloaded the package immediately let QA personnel know and put the strong smelling package in a tote away from the area. The trailer was checked for any further spillage and QA personnel took the hazmat to the hazmat processing area right away so the smell would not negatively affect the package handlers who would soon be unloading the trailer.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LGT experienced a UN3267 Plurasafe Concentrate 1225 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released impacting a 2' x 2' area of the trailer floor. The bottom of the drum was cracked due to a pallet puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon metal overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. All impacted absorbents were then placed into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On July 5, 2023, two (2) 55-gallon drums of adhesive were punctured by a forklift and released approximately eighteen (18) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroCare (EC) to remediate the site. EC personnel deployed granular absorbents to the adhesive-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the two (2) 55-gallon damaged drums were containerized into two (2) 95-gallon over packs for terminal disposal

  • Description: On July 17, 2023, at 1947 ET, XPO Logistics terminal LTU suffered a cargo related release of UN1170 “Steol CS-460 Plus” from a 275-gallon poly tote, impacting the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. On July 17, 2023, at 2341 ET, contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to a 5' x 10' area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. Oil Dri was deployed and utilized to clean the impacted area. The damaged tote was cut up and placed into a 55-gallon metal drum along with all cleanup debris and impacted absorbents. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023070788
item.description:
Report X-2023070788

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box found on van line leaking. Box was isolated from the sort and placed into a red hazmat box with plastic hazmat bag liner. Small amount leaked onto floor beside van line; leak was cleaned with absorbent disposable towels. Outer package did not indicate that item inside was a hazmat; box was brought to QA cage for inspection with other, regular damages. Upon inspection, it was discovered that item inside was a hazmat. Bottle has a loose lid but additionally was packed sideways in its box, allowing leak. Shipping label indicates that this box contains "1 gallon finished floor cleaner," a different (and non-hazmat) product than the disinfecting bathroom cleaner shipped in the box. DescribePack: 1 side of box is wet/torn from leak. Other sides of box appear undamaged. No additional punctures or tears. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When discovered, package was removed from van line and placed in a red hazmat bucket with plastic hazmat bag liner to be brought to QA cage. Leak was minor/mostly contained to the box, but was cleaned with absorbent disposable towels.

DescribePack: One of the four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.3 gallon of fluid via a pinhole-sized puncture to the body, not following any seam. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package and spillage was found inside a lined tote. PPE was donned and ventilation was used.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put into a tote bin, initially taken to QA, I then took the tote bin and moved it to an isolated and well ventilated area. Package was then put into the Hazmat Cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver brought back leaking package DescribePack: 2 32fl oz bottles of NuCalgon Drain Solve in box with packing paper. Lid came off 1 bottle and spilled all liquid into the box and into the delivery truck. Box only marked with directional arrows, no LQ diamonds. Possible that the heat caused the liquid to expand and pop cap off as this is the 3rd package of this material that has been found damaged in 2 days. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Driver placed package inside a plastic bag and gave to QA when he returned to the station

item.title: Report E-2023070540
item.description:
Report E-2023070540

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: ROMA
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AIR PACKAGE SHIPPING FROM ITALY TO THE UNITED KINGDOM WAS SUSPECTED TO CONTAIN DANGEROUS GOODS DUE TO THE RATTLE SOUND OF AN AEROSOL. UPON INSPECTION DISCOVERED ON FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CAN OF BALLISTOL, 200 ML. THE PACKAGE WAS SCANNED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER FOR FLIGHT BUT WAS REMOVED PRIOR TO TAKING FLIGHT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING TO INDICATE AN AEROSOL WAS BEING SHIPPED. THE INVOICE DESCRIPTION IS BAIT SCENT FOR FISHING.

item.title: Report E-2023070536
item.description:
Report E-2023070536

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-04
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 4, 2023, one (1) 25-pound bag of Jack's Professional 20-10-20 General Purpose (UN1477) that was damaged due to improper securement during loading. As a result, approximately one (1) pound of product was released to the trailer floor and surrounding cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the impacted surface. Crews utilized hand tools to collect and containerize all free-standing product. All undamaged cargo was inspected and repalletized for continued processing and shipping by the facility. The collected product, all UN1477-impacted materials, and the one (1) damaged bag were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The drum was properly labeled and possession of the waste was retained by RLC for disposal through their bulk waste stream

item.title: Report E-2023070535
item.description:
Report E-2023070535

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-03
  • City: YORK
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 3, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of nitric acid had a loosened lid and released approximately one half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the site. Crews inspected the drum and suspected the seal on the lid was faulty. EWI utilized a forklift to place the drum into an over pack drum to be shipped back to the terminal for further evaluation. All released material was neutralized and recovered with absorbents. Impacted absorbents and PPE were placed into a poly liner and removed from the site for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023070529
item.description:
Report E-2023070529

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LHO experienced a UN3264 Bonderite M-ZN 450R release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 25-gallons of product released impacting a 5’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor and a 10' x 15' area of the concrete lot below due to a pallet nail puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023070528
item.description:
Report E-2023070528

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: WEST CHESTER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading drum from trailer with a drum clamp forklift attachment, the drum was not lifted high enough that when the forklift driver was backing over the dockplate the bottom of the drum hit the lip of the dockplate slighting cutting it contributing to the unintentional release, Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and the drum was repaied with drum putty and placed into a recovery container.

item.title: Report E-2023070401
item.description:
Report E-2023070401

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NMP experienced a UN1760 Liquid Alg-Erase release from a 15-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 28' x 4' area of the trailer floor and a 28' x 4' area of the concrete lot below due to a pallet nail puncture. The area was neutralized with citric acid. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged drum and all impacted absorbents were containerized into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023070398
item.description:
Report E-2023070398

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a battery acid release from a 2300-pound UN2794 battery. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of battery acid released impacting the trailer floor and an 8' x 30' area of concrete lot below due to the battery falling off a forklift. Absorbents and neutralizer were deployed and utilized to clean the released acid. The battery was decontaminated, the caps were re-secured, and the battery was secured for shipment on. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon and 30-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023070344
item.description:
Report E-2023070344

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-05
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While loading a pallet of lab pack containers onto a trailer at the Veolia 10 day intransit facility in Dayton, OH, a Veolia operator noticed an odor coming from the pallet. Initially, the employee did not see any damaged or wet boxes, so he proceeded to break down the pallet to inspect each box. After breaking down the pallet, a wet Questar box (141G) was discovered. Veolia estimates approximately one quart of liquid was released during the spill, most of which was absorbed by the fiber box. It appears that a bottle of allyl bromide broke in transit leading to the saturation of the box and release of liquid. The small amount of liquid that was released outside of the fiber box remained on the pallet under the box. The leaking box and spill pads used to clean up the spill were overpacked together for continued transportation to the final disposal facility.

item.title: Report E-2023070307
item.description:
Report E-2023070307

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USA experienced a release from a box containing multiple 55-pound poly bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 75-pounds of product released impacting a 6' x 15' area of trailer floor due to the closure on the bags being loose. Contractors resecured the bags and tightened the closures. The bags were each then placed into their own poly liners to prevent further release. The released product was then collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023070258
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LHO experienced a UN2735 Jeffamine D-400 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of product released impacting a 4' x 5' area of trailer floor and a 5' x 10' area on the asphalt lot below due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was overpacked into an 85-gallon poly drum. Absorbents and K-Safe neutralizer were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All cleanup debris and impacted absorbents were then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and will be returned to the sender after an amended declaration has been obtained.

  • City: AURORA

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 30, 2023, sixteen (16) one-gallon paint pails were damaged during transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works Inc (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents to the ink-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All damaged pails and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L. Crews secured the scene and demobilized.

  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 30, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote's cap came loose and released five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surface. The cap was resecured. HCE deployed absorbents to the released material and utilized hand tools to collect the impacted solids. All waste was contained in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The drum was labeled and staged onsite to be profiled and disposed of by R+L personnel.

  • Description: On June 29, 2023, one (1) 50-pound bag of potassium hydroxide was damaged by a skid and released approximately three (3) cups of product to the parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted surface. E3 personnel deployed absorbent pads and hand tools to the potassium hydroxide-impacted roadway. All spent absorbent pads were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon pail for terminal disposal. Crews secured the scene and demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2023070526
item.description:
Report E-2023070526

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: WILLISTON
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While loading an IBC into a trailer, forklift operator did not realize the forkblades from his forklift were protruding from it and as a result the forkblades hit and punctured another IBC already staged in the trailer consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Immediate containment procedures were put in place by Level III Hazwoper employees. Local authorities and a local third party spill response company were contacted. The VT State Hazmat Team responded as did our third party spill responder company. Spilled material was contained, neutralized, and cleaned up with various absorbents which were placed into various recovery containers. The remaining product that was still in IBC was neutralized and pumped out and placed into a recovery container. The punctured IBC was cut up and placed into recovery containers for proper disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2023070474

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: KINGMAN
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: COFFEYVILLE RESOUCES CRUDE TRANSPORTATION, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Our transport driver was Southbound on K14 when it left the roadway to the West and then corrected back onto the roadway. Our transport driver then over-corrected and entered the West ditch again. The vehicle overturned and came to rest on its driver's side facing South. The tanker trailer was breached upon impact causing the contents (Ethanol) to leak out. The incident took place at 12:11pm. The roadway was shut down by Kansas Highway Patrol when they arrived at the scene around 12:30pm. Sedgwick County HAZ-Mat Response Team was was dispatched to mitigate the effects of the release. The Ethanol was released into the soil, which was dug up by our remediation crew over the following days. The K14 was opened back up at 7:30pm when the transport and trailer were towed away.

  • City: HUMBLE

  • Carrier/Reporter: WORLDWIDE FLIGHT SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 6/23/2023 at 1845, Cargo Ramp Crew Agent was preparing the CA4 gate for the arrival of TK6060. Two shipments of class 9 barrels on skids for Eva Air were briefly staged outside of the warehouse to clear the DG for the TK flight. Personnel attempted to move the barrels to make room for the arriving flight. As he did so, his forks punctured one of the barrels as his forks went through a skid and hit the barrel behind the load that he was carrying. All of the contents of the barrel spilled on the ramp and some into the drainage. IAH Airport Operations was notified with HFD responding. NRC and TECQ were notified.

item.title: Report X-2023060813
item.description:
Report X-2023060813

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-08
  • City: WATERLOO
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 06-08-2023 a CN Mechanical employee observed liquid dripping from the bottom outlet valve of rail car # HSRX 3393 while performing an inbound train inspection at the CN Waterloo Yard in Waterloo, Iowa. The employee notified the CN Yard Coordinator who in turn made the proper notifications to all departments. CN Dangerous Goods Officer upon arrival and inspection found the bottom outlet valve cap to be less than tool tight and the bottom outlet valve handle to not be in the fully closed position, allowing product to enter the cap and leak out. The bottom outlet valve was moved to the fully closed position. The BOV cap was then removed and observed for 20 minutes to ensure there was no further leakage from the valve. The bottom outlet valve cap was then re-installed and tightened with a 36" pipe wrench. Rail car was released back to CN transportation for continued movement to destination.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE QA WAS WORKING, A CUSHMAN DRIVER BROUGHT THE PACKAGE OVER TO THEM AND INDICATED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE AND HAD NO DIRECTIONAL ARROWS AND NO DIAMOND MARKINGS ON THE OUTSIDE. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND PLACED IN THE PROCESSING CAGE.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: We opened the trailer door and upon doing so we saw the hazmat with a wet spot and foam on the side of the box. Upon seeing it we prepared ourselves to handle the hazmat by ensuring no one came over until it was cleaned up, we got the correct PPE gear to handle the small spill and placed everything into a yellow drum with a hazmat bag inside. DescribePack: The failure to the package was the lid not being secure and the liquid had leaked only on one side of the package which caused the whole side of the box to become open including the inner box that the 4-gallon hazardous items were located in. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: we quickly and effectively gathered a yellow drum to place the hazmat as to not allow it to damage any packages and place absorbent to ensure everything was clean and ready for use.

THEN USED THE SOAKING AGENT POWDER TO SOAK UP LEAKAGE AND CLEAN AREA. DescribePack: BOX WAS TORN OPEN BY CORROSIVE LEAKAGE FROM BOTTLES THAT HAD LOOSE CAPS. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: QUALITY ASSURANE USED PROPER SAFETY EQUIPMENT TO PICKUP HAZMAT & PUT INTO YELLOW HAZMAT DRUM.   • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazardous material drum was inspected and processed by the QA team. It was then put onto a tugger cart to be taken to a trailer to be loaded. When the bucket was placed on to the tugger cart and started travelling, the liquid inside of the drum started to leak out of the top seal. When the tugger operator reached the load end, he notified management. The liquid got on the tugger cart and on the outside of the drum. No physical contact was made with the liquid by any employees. DescribePack: The lid to the drum did not fit correctly or was improperly sealed. No visible damage to the cap/outer container was found. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The drum was immediately set on to a flat stable surface away from the operation to prevent any further spillage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Admin discovered a leaking package in a UNPOP Y-rated fiberboard box with product label on the side and a faded but not illegible barcode; no diamond label or proper shipping name marked. The package was found on the HMPA staging pallet. When attempting to decipher the barcode via DTL, ten other potential undeclared hazmats were found in the shipment. Due to being unable to trap the packages or strip the trailer, SALT (the next destination) was notified of the incoming Undeclared hazmats. DescribePack: One of four 3.78 liter plastic bottles lost 2.6L of fluid due to a loose cap closure and minor denting. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Class 3 Spill PPE was donned, the SDS was consulted, and ventilation was utilized.

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023070593 SequenceEvent: Item arrived to facility damaged. QA was notified and immediately took action. QA responded with both a bucket and red bag to placed damaged item into. Item was then brought back to hazmat cage where it was processed and handled according to guidelines. DescribePack: Package had loose caps which caused interior leakage. Spillage was not much however, it was enough to cause damage to the exterior of package as well as interior contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package caps were tightened and placed in red bag to prevent further spillage. 2. X-2023070594 SequenceEvent: Upon arrival to facility, package was damaged. QA was called to unload are to assist in removing items. Once there, the package was placed inside a red bag and then added to a container. QA brought the tote with container over to the hazmat cage where the item was then dealt with accordingly. HESS, 105 & 39 as well as DPR and ISR was completed on package. DescribePack: Package contained bottles that had loose caps. The loose caps caused the liquid to spill our of the plastic bottles and into the box. In return, the exterior package was also damaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Items were placed in a plastic tote and contained within a red bag. This helped prevent any further leakage. 3. X-2023070595 SequenceEvent: Package was leaking upon arrival. QA was notified and immediately responded to area where package was located. Item was then placed into a bag that was then placed into a tote and brought back to hazmat location. Item was handled accordingly. DPR, ISF, and HESS reports were done on this package. DescribePack: Package contained two plastic both of which contained 44oz. of disinfectant. Both bottles had loose caps that caused the bottles to leak into the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once package was picked up from unload area, it was placed into a tote that was then brought to QA location and processed according to standards.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE QA DID A DOCK WALK, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS IN A TOTE LEAKING. QA GRABBED A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG AND PLACED THE CONTENTS INSIDE. THE BOX HAD NO MARKINGS ON IT FOR DIRECTIONAL ARROWS OR LIMITED QUANTITY. THEY NOTICED IT HAD A STRONG ODOR (ACIDIC) AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS DROPPED AND CAUSED THE CONTAINERS TO BECOME CRUSHED IN. PLUS, THE PACKAGE HAD NO DIRECTIONAL ARROWS ON IT STATING WHICH WAY THE BOTTLES WERE FACING. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG.

  • Description: On June 28, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote of organic peroxide leaked approximately one (1) pint of product to the trailer interior due to a faulty lid. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted surface. FCE personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged lid were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L. FCE personnel replaced the lid on the 330-gallon tote.

item.title: Report E-2023070289
item.description:
Report E-2023070289

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: SCHENECTADY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 6/20/2023 a Veolia employee from the Schenectady, NY office was loading drums from a trailer into another trailer at the Veolia, Schenectady, NY ten day intransit facility when the employee clipped a 55-gallon steel drum with the corner of a pallet while placing it in an outbound trailer. The leak occurred when the employee was loading drums into the trailer and the employee misjudged how close the pallet was to the drums that were already in the trailer for shipment. The 55 gallon drum containing flammable liquids was mostly dented but a small crease caused a leak from the drum and about a liter leaked out of the impacted drum. Liquid was only observed on trailer right below drum and did not leak out of the vehicle. The drum was overpacked into an 85 gallon salvage drum, the spill cleaned up, and transportation to the ultimate disposal facility was continued. The drum leaked about 1 liter of a class 3 flammable liquid solution. The liquid was cleaned up with spill pads and absorbent and the lid on the drum was overpacked properly to prevent it from spilling. The duration of release is anticipated to be less than 1 minute as the employee noticed the accident right away and an estimated 1 liter of flammable liquids leaked.

Report E-2023070273

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: AZUSA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG West, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG West, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank. The driver inadvertently opened a valve on the trailer without making sure all of the necessary connections were made. This allowed approximately 10 gallons of gasoline to be released. The customer dispatched a clean-up crew to the site to handle the remediation.

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SUPERVISOR RADIO IN HAZMAT LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED AT THE LEAKER AND CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE ON HOW TO RESPOND TO THE LEAKER. FOLLOWING THE CORRECT METHODS OULTLINED IN THE DECISION TREE THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER THEN BROUGHT THE LEAKER BACK TO DMP FOR APPRIATE DIPOSAL PROCEDURE
